item.title: 刚好前段时间在做国外股市热门 https://t.co/516Y770Tbo ，抓取了reddit的stocks，investing, wallstreetbet还有一些推特的财经博主的热门推，用deepl把大纲翻译成中文，所以算是全程目睹了 $GME 的从开始到现在的热度。 看起来这个站点还是有用的！

item.title: 不同种类的房子的英文单词汇总
item.description: 这是我在 Anki 上标记为 buiding Tag 的一些单词，不得不感叹外国人的房子种类可真多，记录如下： Table of Contents 详细解释 Apartment-公寓 Item Value 单词 apartment 中译 公寓 音标 [əpɑ́ːrtmənt…
item.content:encoded:
这是我在 Anki 上标记为 buiding Tag 的一些单词，不得不感叹外国人的房子种类可真多，记录如下：

Table of Contents

  • 详细解释

    • Apartment-公寓
    • Greenhouse-温室
    • Hut-小屋
    • Lodge-小屋
    • Shed-棚子
    • Cottage-农舍
    • Barn-谷仓
    • Chapel-礼拜堂
    • Cabin-小屋
    • Abbey-修道院
    • Attic-阁楼
    • Manor-庄园
    • Nursery-幼儿房
    • Mansion-豪宅

详细解释

Apartment-公寓

ItemValue
单词apartment
中译公寓
音标[əpɑ́ːrtmənt]
MeaningAn apartment is a set of rooms in a building where people live.
ExampleShe has a nice apartment in the city.

Greenhouse-温室

ItemValue
单词greenhouse
中译温室
音标[gríːnhàus]
MeaningA greenhouse is a small glass building that is used to grow plants.
ExampleWe have a small greenhouse in our backyard where we grow plants.

Hut-小屋

ItemValue
单词hut
中译小屋
音标[hʌt]
MeaningA hut is a house made of wood, grass, or mud that has only one or two rooms.
ExampleWe all went into the hut to sleep.

Lodge-小屋

ItemValue
单词lodge
中译小屋
音标[lɑdʒ]
MeaningA lodge is a house in the mountains used by people who hunt or fish.
ExampleDuring our ski trip, we stayed at a lodge.

Shed-棚子

ItemValue
单词shed
中译棚子
音标[ʃed]
MeaningA shed is a small building in which people store things like tools.
ExampleWe have a small shed in the backyard for storage.

Cottage-农舍

ItemValue
单词cottage
中译农舍
音标[kɑ́tidʒ]
MeaningA cottage is a small, old house in the countryside.
ExampleMy aunt lives in a pretty cottage in the mountains.

Barn-谷仓

ItemValue
单词barn
中译谷仓
音标[baːrn]
MeaningA barn is a large farm building that houses crops, equipment, and animals.
ExampleMy grandparents keep hay in their red barn.

Chapel-礼拜堂

ItemValue
单词chapel
中译礼拜堂
音标[ʧǽpəl]
MeaningA chapel is a building where people go to pray and worship God.
ExampleWe were married in a small wedding chapel in Las Vegas.

Cabin-小屋

ItemValue
单词cabin
中译小屋
音标[kǽbin]
MeaningA cabin is a small wooden house in a forest or camping area.
ExampleThe man reached the mountain cabin after a long day of hiking along the river.

Abbey-修道院

ItemValue
单词abbey
中译修道院
音标[ǽbi]
MeaningAn abbey is a house, or group of houses, where monks or nuns live.
ExampleWhen the monk returned to the abbey, he went immediately to his bedroom.

Attic-阁楼

ItemValue
单词attic
中译阁楼
音标[ǽtik]
MeaningAn attic is a room just below a house’s roof.
ExampleThere were two windows in their attic.

Manor-庄园

ItemValue
单词manor
中译庄园
音标[mǽnər]
MeaningA manor is a large house with many rooms.
ExampleThe manor had over forty rooms and beautiful gardens.

Nursery-幼儿房

ItemValue
单词nursery
中译幼儿房
音标[nə́ːrsəri:]
MeaningA nursery is a room where babies and children sleep, play, or are cared for.
ExampleThe children kissed their parents goodnight and went upstairs to the nursery.

Mansion-豪宅

ItemValue
单词mansion
中译豪宅
音标[mǽnʃən]
MeaningA mansion is a large and expensive home.
ExampleThe mansion had thirty bedrooms, two kitchens, and a pool.

item.title: 犯罪相关的英文单词汇总
item.description: 这是我在 Anki 上标记为 crime Tag 的一些单词，比如 jail(监狱), arrest(逮捕)，记录如下： Table of Contents 详细解释 Steal-偷窃 Item Value 单词 steal 中译 偷窃 音标 [stiːl] Meaning To…
item.content:encoded:
这是我在 Anki 上标记为 crime Tag 的一些单词，比如 jail(监狱), arrest(逮捕)，记录如下：

Table of Contents

  • 详细解释

    • Steal-偷窃
    • Thief-小偷
    • Jail-监狱
    • Victim-受害者
    • Trial-审判
    • Arrest-逮捕
    • Convict-被宣判有罪
    • Innocent-无辜的
    • Kidnap-绑架
    • Confess-招供
    • Outlaw-不法之徒
    • Sin-罪过
    • Detain-扣留
    • Prisoner-囚犯
    • Violate-违反规定
    • Fraud-欺诈
    • Villain-“恶棍”
    • Assassin-刺客
    • Conspiracy-共谋
    • Custody-羁押
    • Crime-犯罪行为
    • Offense-犯罪行为
    • Implicate-牵涉其中
    • Amnesty-大赦国际
    • Captive-俘虏
    • Culprit-罪魁祸首
    • Ransom-赎金

详细解释

Steal-偷窃

ItemValue
单词steal
中译偷窃
音标[stiːl]
MeaningTo steal is to take something that is not yours.
ExampleThe men tried to steal money from the bank.

Thief-小偷

ItemValue
单词thief
中译小偷
音标[θiːf]
MeaningA thief is someone who quietly takes things that do not belong to them.
ExampleA thief broke into our home and took my mother’s jewelry.

Jail-监狱

ItemValue
单词jail
中译监狱
音标[dʒeil]
MeaningA jail is a place to keep bad people.
ExampleHe was sent to jail for taking other people’s cars.

Victim-受害者

ItemValue
单词victim
中译受害者
音标[víktim]
MeaningA victim is a person who is hurt by a bad action.
ExampleI was a victim of a robbery.

Trial-审判

ItemValue
单词trial
中译审判
音标[tráiəl]
MeaningA trial is the way a court discovers if a person is guilty or innocent.
ExampleHe went on trial for robbing the bank.

Arrest-逮捕

ItemValue
单词arrest
中译逮捕
音标[ərést]
MeaningTo arrest someone means to catch that person for doing something bad.
ExampleThe man was arrested for breaking the law.

Convict-被宣判有罪

ItemValue
单词convict
中译有罪
音标[kənvíkt]
MeaningTo convict means to prove that someone did a bad thing.
ExampleHe was convicted of the crime and sent to jail.

Innocent-无辜的

ItemValue
单词innocent
中译无辜的
音标[ínəsnt]
MeaningAn innocent person is not guilty of a crime.
ExampleThe judge said that the woman was innocent of the crime.

Kidnap-绑架

ItemValue
单词kidnap
中译绑架
音标[kídnæ̀p]
MeaningTo kidnap someone is to take that person illegally.
ExampleShe was terrified to find out her son had been kidnapped.

Confess-招供

ItemValue
单词confess
中译招供
音标[kənfés]
MeaningTo confess is to admit a bad or embarrassing truth.
ExampleThe woman confessed that she had stolen the money.

Outlaw-不法之徒

ItemValue
单词outlaw
中译不法之徒
音标[áutlɔ̀ː]
MeaningAn outlaw is a criminal who hides from the police.
ExampleThe police passed out posters of the outlaw to all the people.

Sin-罪过

ItemValue
单词sin
中译罪过
音标[sin]
MeaningA sin is something that is wrong for religious reasons.
ExampleTaking something that doesn’t belong to you is a sin.

Detain-扣留

ItemValue
单词detain
中译扣留
音标[ditéin]
MeaningTo detain is to officially prevent someone from leaving a place.
ExampleThe police had to detain the thief for shoplifting.

Prisoner-囚犯

ItemValue
单词prisoner
中译囚犯
音标[prízənər]
MeaningA prisoner is someone who is taken by force and kept somewhere.
ExampleHe has been a prisoner for many years.

Violate-违反规定

ItemValue
单词violate
中译违反规定
音标[váiəlèit]
MeaningTo violate a law, rule, or agreement means to break it.
ExampleI was given a ticket because the policeman said I violated a traffic law.

Fraud-欺诈

ItemValue
单词fraud
中译欺诈
音标[frɔːd]
MeaningFraud is the crime of gaining money by lying or by tricking people.
ExampleExperts say that credit card fraud increases around the holidays.

Villain-“恶棍”

ItemValue
单词villain
中译“恶棍”
音标[vílən]
MeaningA villain is an evil person who breaks the law or hurts others.
ExampleThe villain made of with half of my family’s valuables.

Assassin-刺客

ItemValue
单词assassin
中译刺客
音标[əsǽsn]
MeaningAn assassin is someone who murders an important person.
ExampleAn assassin killed Martin Luther King on April 4, 1968.

Conspiracy-共谋

ItemValue
单词conspiracy
中译共谋
音标[kənspírəsi]
MeaningA conspiracy is a secret plan that two or more people make together to do something harmful or illegal.
ExampleThe businessman thought there was a conspiracy among his coworkers to get him fired.

Custody-羁押

ItemValue
单词custody
中译羁押
音标[kΛstədi]
MeaningCustody is the right to take care of someone or something.
ExampleThe prisoners were put in the custody of the jailers.

Crime-犯罪行为

ItemValue
单词crime
中译犯罪行为
音标[kraim]
MeaningIf someone commits a crime, he or she does something bad that can be punished by law.
ExamplePolice quickly arrived at the scene of the crime.

Offense-犯罪行为

ItemValue
单词offense
中译犯罪行为
音标[əféns]
MeaningAn offense is an action that breaks the law and requires punishment.
ExampleHe was put in jail for two days for the offense.

Implicate-牵涉其中

ItemValue
单词implicate
中译牵涉其中
音标[ímplikèit]
MeaningTo implicate someone is to show that they have done a crime or something bad.
ExampleThe man was implicated in the theft at the store.

Amnesty-大赦国际

ItemValue
单词amnesty
中译大赦国际
音标[ǽmnəsti:]
MeaningAmnesty is a pardon given to prisoners of war.
ExampleShe was denied amnesty for her involvement in the war.

Captive-俘虏

ItemValue
单词captive
中译俘虏
音标[kǽptiv]
MeaningA captive is a prisoner.
ExampleThe guards told the captive that there was no way he could escape the prison.

Culprit-罪魁祸首

ItemValue
单词culprit
中译罪魁祸首
音标[kʌ́lprit]
MeaningA culprit is someone who has committed a crime or other bad deed.
ExampleThe police were still searching for the culprit from the robbery.

Ransom-赎金

ItemValue
单词ransom
中译赎金
音标[rǽnsəm]
MeaningA ransom is a sum of money paid to a kidnapper to set the person free.
ExampleHe kidnapped the prince and demanded $1 million as a ransom.
